Television|Warner Horizon Television]] | country = United States | distributor = [[MTV]] | followed_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 5)|Season 5]] | preceded_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 3)|Season 3]] | network = [[MTV]] (U.S.)
[[MuchMusic]] (Canada) }} The fourth season of ''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]'' premiered on August 9, 2009. All three judges and host [[Mario Lopez]] and backstage correspondent [[Layla Kayleigh]] from the previous seasons signed on for season 4. However, for the first time since the beginning of ABDC, DJ Rashida was not present as the show's DJ, as she was touring with [[Lady GaGa]] and [[JabbaWockeeZ]].http://twitter.com/DJRashida Preceding the first broadcast, MTV announced in a broadcast trailer that the show would be moving to its new Sunday night slot at 9pm ET/PT for the duration of the season. In Canada, [[MuchMusic]] aired this season at the same time as its MTV broadcast. In previous seasons, it was aired 3 days after MTV aired it. Unlike previous seasons, there was no live audition special.http://www.reality-tv-online.com/blog/americas-best-dance-crew-season-4-premier-august-9th-at-900-pm-on-mtv/ On September 27, 2009, [[We Are Heroes]] was declared the winner of Season 4 and received the $100,000 ([[United States dollar|USD]]) prize.http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2009/06/its-official-first-episode-airs-august.html On August 2, 2009, as a prologue for the season four, the show premiered a special hosted by Randy Jackson called "The Top 10 Performances of All Time" where Randy showed his top 10 picks of the first three seasons. This was also the last season to feature Shane Sparks as a judge. ==Crews== Like [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 3)|season 3]], nine crews were selected in this season of ''America's Best Dance Crew''. Also, like the previous season, there was no Live Audition special. The nine crews were not divided into the usual four regions (East, West, Midwest, and South), but each crew's banner still listed where each crew was from. This was also the first season to showcase crews from three regions instead of the four. Continuing the show's crossover with [[So You Think You Can Dance (US)|So You Think You Can Dance]], among the competitors this season is Donyelle Jones from Artistry in Motion, a finalist from the [[So You Think You Can Dance (season 2)|second season]] of So You Think You Can Dance. [[MTV]] began casting for season 4 on June 6, 2009 in Los Angeles. The crews were chosen from across America from the four audition cities ([[New York, New York]]; [[Chicago, Illinois]]; [[Orlando, Florida]]; and [[Los Angeles, California]]) and were recently announced by MTV.http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2009/07/season-4-crews-are-announced.html New York's Vogue Evolution made ABDC history as the first group featuring five openly gay members; one of them being a transgender female. [[We Are Heroes]] of Los Angeles made ABDC history as well by becoming the first all-female crew to win the title of America's Best Dance Crew.

==Performances== *Starting from the Final 5, when a crew gets eliminated, they take a look back at the eliminated crew's journey on the show while playing "[[Let the Truth Be Told (Laura Izibor album)|If Tonight is My Last]]" by [[Laura Izibor]]. === Week 1: Crew's Choice Challenge === *Aired on August 9, 2009 The 9 crews performed to a song of their choosing. The bottom three were chosen by the judges and danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to a mastermix of "[[Boom Boom Pow]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/08/05/inside-info-crews-choice-challenge-song-list-revealed/ |- | Beat Ya Feet Kings | "Skillet" by Backyard Band |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Waters of Nazareth]]" by [[Justice]] |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[El Cantante (soundtrack)|Aguanile]]" by [[Marc Anthony]] |- | Massive Monkees | "[[Seeing Sounds|Kill Joy]]" by [[N.E.R.D.]] |- | Artistry in Motion | "[[Rooty|SFM]]" by [[Basement Jaxx]] |- | Southern Movement | "[[Sideways (Dierks Bentley song)|Sideways]]" by [[Dierks Bentley]] |- | Rhythm City | "Life of a Star" by [[Mims (rapper)|Mims]] |- | Fr3sh | "[[Warriorz|Ante Up]]" by [[M.O.P.]] |- | Vogue Evolution | "Took the Night" by Chelley |} *'''Safe:''' We Are Heroes, AfroBorikÃ©, Massive Monkees, Artistry in Motion, Rhythm City, Vogue Evolution *'''Bottom 3:''' Beat Ya Feet Kings, Southern Movement, Fr3sh *'''Eliminated:''' Fr3sh === Week 2: [[BeyoncÃ©]] Challenge === *Aired on August 16, 2009 Similar to the [[Michael Jackson]], [[Janet Jackson]], [[Missy Elliott]], and [[Britney Spears]] challenges from seasons 1-3, the crews took inspiration and were given a challenge from [[BeyoncÃ©]]'s music videos and tour performances. BeyoncÃ© herself gave each crew their challenges through a video. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/08/12/abdc-ep-2-challenge-bring-on-da-beyonce/ ! Challenge |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)]]" | Take the section of the video known as "The Grind" and create strobe effects. |- | Rhythm City | "[[Sweet Dreams (BeyoncÃ© Knowles song)|Sweet Dreams]]" | Update "[[Charleston (dance)|The Charleston]]" which is featured in the video. |- | Massive Monkees | "[[Work It Out (BeyoncÃ© Knowles song)|Work It Out]]" | Dance with hula hoops without accidentally dropping them. |- | Beat Ya Feet Kings | "[[Crazy in Love (BeyoncÃ© Knowles song)|Crazy In Love]]" | Booty-pop with never before seen flare. |- | Southern Movement | "[[Jumpin' Jumpin']]" by [[Destiny's Child]] | Bust out all of the moves from the video with new creativity. |- | Vogue Evolution | "[[DÃ©jÃ  Vu (BeyoncÃ© Knowles song)|DÃ©jÃ  Vu]]" | Perform African-style dancing within their routine. |- | Artistry in Motion | "[[Diva (BeyoncÃ© Knowles song)|Diva]]" | Perform with chains incorporating the entire crew. |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[Beautiful Liar]]" by BeyoncÃ© and [[Shakira]] | Work exotic [[Shakira]]-like moves into the routine. |} *'''Safe:''' We Are Heroes, Rhythm City, Massive Monkees, Beat Ya Feet Kings, Southern Movement, Vogue Evolution *'''Bottom 2:''' Artistry in Motion, AfroBorikÃ© *'''Eliminated:''' Artistry in Motion === Week 3: Martial Arts Challenge === *Aired on August 23, 2009 The crews emulated martial arts in their routine. [[Quest Crew]]'s Steve Terada appeared as a guest instructor.http://questcrewfusion.com/?p=1725 {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/08/18/abdcs-ep-3-challenge-karate-chop-to-the-face/ ! Martial Art ! Challenge |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[I Know You Want Me (Calle Ocho)]]" by [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] | [[Capoeira]] | Cartwheel |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Starstrukk]]" by [[3OH!3]] | [[Karate]] | The Flying Fist |- | Vogue Evolution | "[[Work (Ciara song)|Work]]" by [[Ciara]] featuring [[Missy Elliott]] | [[Shaolin Kung Fu]] | Tiger-Style move |- | Massive Monkees | "[[Fist of God|Bounce]]" by [[MSTRKRFT]] featuring [[NORE]] | [[Extreme Martial Arts]] | The 540 kick |- | Beat Ya Feet Kings | "[[Chillin (Wale song)|Chillin']]" by [[Wale]] featuring [[Lady Gaga]] | [[Taekwondo]] | Foot Fake |- | Rhythm City | "[[Party Rock|La La La]]" by [[LMFAO (band)|LMFAO]] | [[Muay Thai]] | Killer Elbow |- | Southern Movement | "[[Dark Days, Bright Nights|Ugly]]" by [[Bubba Sparxxx]] | [[Kali (martial art)|Kali]] | Knee Slide |} *'''Moving On:''' AfroBorikÃ©, We Are Heroes, Vogue Evolution, Massive Monkees, Beat Ya Feet Kings *'''Bottom 2:''' Rhythm City, Southern Movement *'''Eliminated:''' Southern Movement ===Week 4: Bollywood Challenge=== *Aired on August 30, 2009 The six remaining crews were challenged to infuse the dance moves of the popular Bollywood culture in India with their routines. In order to learn the complex Indian-themed dance style, the crews met with renowned Bollywood choreographer [[Nakul Dev Mahajan]].http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/08/26/can-the-abdcrews-learn-bollywood-in-a-week/ {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/08/25/abdc-ep-4-challenge-hollywood-goes-bollywood/ ! Challenge |- | Massive Monkees | "[[Fast & Furious (soundtrack)|Bang]]" by [[Rye Rye]] featuring [[M.I.A. (artist)|M.I.A.]] | [[Bhangra]] |- | Vogue Evolution | "[[Calabria (song)|Calabria 2008]]" by [[Enur]] | [[Rajasthan]]i |- | Rhythm City | "[[Jai Ho! (You Are My Destiny)]]" by [[A.R. Rahman]] and [[Pussycat Dolls]] | [[Bharatanatyam]] |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[Dance Bailalo]]" by [[Kat DeLuna]] | [[Kathak]] |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Arab Money]]" by [[Busta Rhymes]] and [[Ron Browz]] | [[Giddha]] |- | Beat Ya Feet Kings | "[[So Fine (Sean Paul song)|So Fine]]" by [[Sean Paul]] | [[Garba (dance)|Garba]] |} *'''Safe:''' Massive Monkees, Vogue Evolution, Rhythm City, AfroBorikÃ© *'''Bottom 2:''' We Are Heroes, Beat Ya Feet Kings *'''Eliminated:''' Beat Ya Feet Kings === Week 5: Dance Craze Challenge === *Aired on September 6, 2009 The five remaining crews were given some of the nation's hottest dance crazes, including the Stanky Legg and Jerkin'. Similar versions of this challenge were used in the three previous seasons. The crews also had use the trampoline built into the stage in their routines. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/09/01/abdc-ep-5-challenge-its-about-to-get-craze-y/ ! Challenge |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[Swag Surfin']]" by [[Fast Life Yungstaz]] | Swag Surfin' |- | Massive Monkees | "Do The Ricky Bobby" by B-Hamp | Ricky Bobby |- | Rhythm City | "[[You're a Jerk]]" by [[New Boyz]] | [[Jerkin']] |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Stanky Legg]]" by [[GS Boyz]] | Stanky Legg |- | Vogue Evolution | "[[Halle Berry (She's Fine)|Halle Berry]]" by [[Hurricane Chris (rapper)|Hurricane Chris]] | Halle Berry |} *'''Safe:''' AfroBorikÃ©, Massive Monkees, Rhythm City *'''Bottom 2:''' We Are Heroes, Vogue Evolution *'''Eliminated:''' Vogue Evolution === Week 6: [[MTV Video Music Awards|VMA]] Challenge=== *Aired on September 13, 2009 The episode was aired on September 13 as part of the VMA lineup. The episode aired at 7PM/6C, one hour before the VMA preshow. The final four crews paid homage to the most memorable VMA performances of all time. The four crews performed together in an opening number to "[[Smooth Criminal]]" by [[Michael Jackson]].http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/09/09/abdcrews-honor-michael-jackson-with-a-smooth-opening-numba/ {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/09/08/final-four-vma-challenge-from-madonna-to-britney/ ! Challenge |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Vogue (Madonna song)|Vogue]]" by [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] | Incorporate the routine by using vogue and hand-fans from the performance |- | AfroBorikÃ© | "[[I'm a Slave 4 U]]" by [[Britney Spears]] | Include the partner section and the snake in the routine |- | Massive Monkees | "[[Tearin' Up My Heart]]" by [['N Sync|*NSYNC]] | Work the popping section from the performance into the routine |- | Rhythm City | "[[Wall to Wall (song)|Wall To Wall]]" by [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] | Incorporate the Charlie Chaplin section from the performance |} *'''Safe:''' We Are Heroes, AfroBorikÃ© *'''Bottom 2:''' Massive Monkees, Rhythm City *'''Eliminated:''' Rhythm City === Week 7: Decades of Dance Challenge and Last Chance Challenge=== *Aired on September 20, 2009 This week on ABDC, the crews competed against each other in two challenges: the Decade of Dance challenge, in which the crews danced to a master mix of five songs from the past five decades, and the Last Chance Challenge. ====Challenge #1: Decades of Dance Challenge==== The remaining 3 crews emulated moves from great performers of past decades. One crew was given the boot halfway through the show. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Decade ! Songhttp://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2009/09/15/abdc-celebrates-decades-of-dance-in-its-final-challenge/ |- | 1960s | "[[Sex Machine (song)|Sex Machine]]" by [[James Brown]] |- | 1970s | "Uprock" by [[Rock Steady Crew]] |- | 1980s | "[[Cold Hearted]]" by [[Paula Abdul]] |- | 1990s | "[[You Make Me Wanna]]" by [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]] |- | 2000s | "[[LoveGame]]" by [[Lady Gaga]] |} *'''Safe:''' AfroBorikÃ© *'''Bottom 2:''' Massive Monkees, We Are Heroes *'''Eliminated:''' Massive Monkees ====Challenge #2: Last Chance Challenge==== The crews created original beats to groove to during their routine for the Last Chance Challenge to show America why ''they'' should be crowned the winner. The remaining two crews then performed their prepared routines before the lines opened for the final voting session of the season. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Performance Title |- | AfroBorikÃ© | RaÃ­ces |- | We Are Heroes | Ichiban |- |} === Week 8: The Live Finale=== *Aired on September 27, 2009 The eliminated crews of season 4 returned and teamed up with the remaining two crews for the judge's choice of crews collaboration. The judges each picked three crews that complemented each other and their dance-styles. Instead of going head-to-head, AfroBorikÃ© and We Are Heroes teamed up for their last performance. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crews ! Song |- | '''[[Lil Mama]]:''' We Are Heroes, Vogue Evolution and Artistry in Motion | "Girls On The Dance Floor" by [[Far East Movement]] |- | '''[[JC Chasez]]:''' AfroBorikÃ©, Rhythm City and Fr3sh | "[[Fire Burning]]" by [[Sean Kingston]] |- | '''[[Shane Sparks]]:''' Massive Monkees, Beat Ya Feet Kings and Southern Movement | "[[Crunk Rock|I Do]]" by [[Lil Jon]] featuring [[Swizz Beatz]] & [[Snoop Dogg]] |- | We Are Heroes and AfroBorikÃ© | "[[I Gotta Feeling]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]] |- | We Are Heroes | "[[Lil Jon discography|I'm The Ish]]" by DJ Class featuring [[Lil Jon]] |} On September 27, 2009, [[We Are Heroes]] was crowned the winner of '''America's Best Dance Crew Season 4''', while AfroBorikÃ© was declared the runner-up. *'''Winner:''' We Are Heroes *'''Runner-up:''' AfroBorikÃ© == References == {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]''|before=[[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 3)|Season 3]]|after=[[America's Best Dance Crew (season 5)|Season 5]]|years='''''Season 4'''''}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.mtv.com/ontv/dyn/dance_crew/series.jhtml}} {{America's Best Dance Crew}} {{DEFAULTSORT:America's Best Dance Crew (Season 4)}} [[Category:2009 television seasons]] [[Category:Dance competitions]] [[no:America's Best Dance Crew (sesong 4)]]
